content.description:
This is a gorgeous line situated on the top of Guano Rock. Match on perfect finger bucket.  Make a move to a incut crimp with your right hand.  Do a big move left to an incut crimp on the arete (intermediate hold right at your face).

It has a sloper topout.
content.location: It is on top of Guano Rock.

content.description: This short, little problem is defined by great starting rail and great upper rail. Depending on how you place your feet and use the face to the left, this can be a fun pull or a great dyno.
content.location:
It is between

Guano.1

and

Guano.7

.

content.description:
Same start as

Guano.6

, but go out right to good holds in the seam.  Deadpoint to the next seam.  Top out on big holds.

Keep your feet above (and watch out for) the ledge you climb over.
content.location:
This is just right of

Guano.6

.

content.description: This is a contrived line, staying right of the arete and left of the vertical seam. It has very sharp crimps, but it is great when it can be put together. Start matched on the low jugs.
content.location:
It is just right of

Guano.5

.

content.description:
Climb a slightly overhanging face with a roof block capping the line for few feet.

Start matched on the lower crack and go into the fat crack on the face.  Go into the jug at the base of the roof block and top it out (extra points for going straight over the bulge instead of traversing out left).
content.location:
This is on the West side of Guano.  Continue walking around from

Guano.4

or go left of

Guano.1

.

content.description:
There is much more coarse granite on this entire side of the rock, but some easier lines are possible here.  Play with large holds in the cracks.

Walk off to the right.
content.location:
This is just right of

Guano.3

.

content.description:
Do the same sit-start on the protruding block, but go right to the blunt arete - great feet.

Walk off the backside of the boulder.
content.location:
This is just right of

Guano.2

.

content.description:
Sit-start on the protruding block and go up crimps and a great sidepull in the crack to the top of the boulder.

Walk off the uphill side of the boulder.
content.location:
This is the next route to the right of

Guano.1

.

content.description:
This is the first line you see as you walk uphill to the boulder. Start on the low horizontal crack.  Move to the jug flake, then move straight up to the big flat white jug. Depending on how much of the left wall you want to use, this can be really easy or more challenging. Walk off to your right after establishing on the ledge.

(This is the only line you need to watch for the guano....)
